column1: Baar is a municipality in the canton of Zug in Switzerland.
== History ==
Baar is first mentioned in 1045 as Barra.
== Geography ==
Baar has an area
column3: of 24.85 km2 (9.59 sq mi). Of this area
column5: while 25% is forested.  Of the rest of the land
column6: 22.8% is settled (buildings or roads) and the remainder (0.8%) is non-productive (rivers
column7: glaciers or mountains).The municipality is located in the northern portion of the flood plain of the Lorze river.  It was originally a linear village along the road between Lake Zug and Lake Zurich.  Since the 1960s it has grown rapidly. It consists of the village of Baar and the former hamlets of Allenwinden
column9: as well as the farm houses of Deinikon.

column1: == Demographics ==
Baar has a population (as of 31 December 2019) of 24
column3: 24.9% of the population was made up of foreign nationals.  Over the last 10 years

column1: == Education ==

In Baar about 72% of the population (between age 25-64) have completed either non-mandatory upper secondary education or additional higher education (either university or a Fachhochschule).Baar is home to the International School of Zug and Luzern
column2: or ISZL.  The ISZL is an independent co-educational
column4: from Pre-School to Grade 12 serving the international community of Central Switzerland.

column1: Baar has an unemployment rate of 2.26%.  As of 2005
column2: there were 333 people employed in the primary economic sector and about 94 businesses involved in this sector.  3

column1: == Transportation ==
Baar railway station is a stop on the InterRegio service between Zürich Hauptbahnhof and Lucerne
column3: as well as on the Zurich S-Bahn service S24 between Zug and Zürich Oerlikon. Several stops of the Stadtbahn Zug are in Baar.

column1: In the summer months it is possible to rent free bikes to bike around Baar. This can be done near the Rathaus.
== Notable people ==
Martin Schmid (1694 in Baar – 1772) Jesuit
Max Huber (1919 in Baar – 1992) an influential graphic designer
Yvonne Gilli (born 1957 in Baar) physician and politician
